results.title: This England. No. 12 [Elizabeth I, 1593]
results.brief_description: Set in 1593, this film is a pictorial documentation of Queen Elizabeth I’s reign at the age of 60 after 35 years in the throne. The film canvasses a number of her achievements but focuses on her falling in love with the Earl of Essex in the last ten years of her life. Queen Elizabeth died in 1603 following her execution of the Earl.

results.title: This England. No. 11 [Elizabeth I, 1580]
results.brief_description: Continues the story of Elizabeth I’s reign, featuring Philip II of Spain, and Sir Francis Drake and Hawkins defeating the mighty Armada.

results.title: This England. No. 10 [Elizabeth I and Mary, Queen of Scots, 1568]
results.brief_description: Using paintings, drawings and sketches, this episode tells of the year 1568 and the rivalry between Queen Elizabeth I and Mary, Queen of Scots. Covers Mary’s captivity in England and her subsequent death sentence.

results.title: This charming couple
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Willard Van Dyke, Affiliated Film Producers and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
The film focuses on the false ideals of romantic love on which too many marriages are built. It follows the courtship of two young people who refuse to evaluate each other’s qualities and shortcomings in a realistic adult way. They are unwilling or unable to alter their romanticised ideas of each other to agree with actual facts. Because they are in love with love and not each other their marriage is doomed.

results.title: This Bloomin' world
results.brief_description: A study of the colour and form of a flower, contrasting the beauty of a flower with the insensitivity to nature by humans. Aims to increase awareness by showing communities which have used flowers to improve their environment. Uses microphotography and music.

results.title: This Automation age
results.brief_description: An explanation and history of automation and the benefits and problems it can bring. Animated techniques are used to explain the meaning of automation, and the film illustrates its application in different walks of life.

results.title: This'll do me
results.brief_description: Scenes showing the manufacture and use of fibrous plaster products are used to illustrate the various opportunities for employment in the fibrous plaster industry. Shows the manufacture of plaster sheet and cornice moulds and also the making by hand of moulds for commemorative plaques, complicated patterns used in interior design, window display modellings and other materials requiring the work of skilled artists.

results.title: Thirty million letters
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films, General Post Office and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: Every night in Britain, thirty million letters go through the post. This film shows the processes behind the safe delivery of this mail with emphasis on the travelling post office, and sorting, transport and delivery from Euston Station. The film also sees the service from the postman’s point of view, whether at work in the Outer Hebrides or on a daily round in London.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films, General Post Office and James Ritchie

results.title: Thirty-six weeks behaviour day
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: The infant boy whose behaviour day at 12 weeks was charted is now 36 weeks old. His reactions are compared with those which he experienced 24 weeks earlier. His responses to the ministrations of his father and mother are commented upon. The very first successful crawling efforts are observed.
